001package org.krmdemo.techlabs.core.utils;
002
003import org.apache.commons.io.IOUtils;
004
005import java.io.File;
006import java.io.FileOutputStream;
007import java.io.IOException;
008import java.io.InputStream;
009import java.net.URISyntaxException;
010import java.net.URL;
011import java.nio.charset.Charset;
012import java.nio.file.Files;
013import java.nio.file.Path;
014import java.nio.file.Paths;
015import java.nio.file.StandardCopyOption;
016import java.nio.file.StandardOpenOption;
017import java.util.Arrays;
018import java.util.List;
019import java.util.Optional;
020
021/**
022 * Utility-class to load the classpath-resources and copy them to the local file system,
023 * that invokes standard JDK utilities, but wraps {@link java.io.IOException}
024 * into {@link IllegalStateException} and creates missing parent directories.
025 * <hr/>
026 * TODO: cover each method with tests
027 */
028public class CoreResourceUtils {
029
030    /**
031     * Loading the content of classpath-resource by path {@code file} as {@link String}
032     * (it's allowed to use for text-resources only) and throws {@link IllegalStateException}
033     * if the resource could not be located or its content could not be loaded for any reason.
034     *
035     * @param resourcePath the absolute path of classpath-resource (without leading {@code '/'}-slash)
036     * @return the content of classpath-resource by path {@code resourcePath} as {@link String}
037     */
038    public static String resourceAsText(String resourcePath) {
039        ClassLoader classLoader = Thread.currentThread().getContextClassLoader();
040        URL resourceUrl = classLoader.getResource(resourcePath);
041        if (resourceUrl == null) {
042            throw new IllegalArgumentException(String.format(
043                "could not locate teh resource by path '%s'", resourcePath));
044        }
045        try (InputStream resourceStream = resourceUrl.openStream()) {
046            return IOUtils.toString(resourceStream, Charset.defaultCharset());
047        } catch (IOException ioEx) {
048            throw new IllegalArgumentException(
049                String.format("could not load the resource by path '%s' (resource URL is '%s')",
050                    resourcePath, resourceUrl), ioEx);
051        }
052    }
053
054    /**
055     * Loading the content of classpath-resource by path {@code file} as {@code Optional<String>},
056     * and the returned value is {@link Optional#empty()} if the resource could not be loaded for any reason.
057     *
058     * @param resourcePath the absolute path of classpath-resource (without leading {@code '/'}-slash)
059     * @return the content of classpath-resource by path {@code resourcePath} or {@link Optional#empty()}
060     */
061    public static Optional<String> resourceAsTextOpt(String resourcePath) {
062        ClassLoader classLoader = Thread.currentThread().getContextClassLoader();
063        URL resourceUrl = classLoader.getResource(resourcePath);
064        if (resourceUrl == null) {
065            return Optional.empty();
066        }
067        try (InputStream resourceStream = resourceUrl.openStream()) {
068            return Optional.of(IOUtils.toString(resourceStream, Charset.defaultCharset()));
069        } catch (IOException ignored) {
070            return Optional.empty();
071        }
072    }
073
074    public static List<String> resourceAsTextList(String... resourcePathArr) {
075        return Arrays.stream(resourcePathArr)
076            .map(CoreResourceUtils::resourceAsTextOpt)
077            .flatMap(Optional::stream)
078            .toList();
079    }
080
081    /**
082     * Copy the classpath-resource by path {@code resourcePath} into the file {@code targetFile}
083     * and creates all missing parent directories if necessary. An existing target file is completely replaced.
084     *
085     * @param resourcePath the absolute path of classpath-resource (without leading {@code '/'}-slash)
086     * @param targetFile the destination file to copy the loaded resource over into
087     */
088    public static void copyResourceToFile(String resourcePath, File targetFile) {
089        if (targetFile == null) {
090            throw new IllegalStateException(String.format(
091                "could not copy the resource by path '%s' because the target file is null", resourcePath));
092        } else if (targetFile.isDirectory()) {
093            throw new IllegalStateException(String.format(
094                "could not copy the resource by path '%s' because existing target '%s' is a directory",
095                resourcePath, targetFile.getAbsoluteFile()));
096        }
097        ClassLoader classLoader = Thread.currentThread().getContextClassLoader();
098        URL resourceUrl = classLoader.getResource(resourcePath);
099        if (resourceUrl == null) {
100            throw new IllegalArgumentException(String.format(
101                "could not locate the resource by path '%s' to copy it into the target file '%s'",
102                resourcePath, targetFile.getAbsoluteFile()));
103        }
104        try (InputStream resourceStream = resourceUrl.openStream()) {
105            if (targetFile.getParentFile() != null) {
106                Files.createDirectories(targetFile.getParentFile().toPath());
107            }
108            Files.copy(resourceStream, targetFile.toPath(), StandardCopyOption.REPLACE_EXISTING);
109        } catch (IOException ioEx) {
110            throw new IllegalStateException(String.format(
111                "could not copy the resource by path '%s' (resource URL is '%s') into the target file '%s'",
112                resourcePath, resourceUrl, targetFile.getAbsoluteFile()), ioEx);
113        }
114    }
115
116    /**
117     * Copy the classpath-resource by path {@code resourcePath} to the taget directory {@code targetDir}
118     * and creates all missing parent directories if necessary (including the target one).
119     * An existing target file is completely replaced.
120     *
121     * @param resourcePath the absolute path of classpath-resource (without leading {@code '/'}-slash)
122     * @param targetDir the destination directory file to copy the loaded resource into
123     */
124    public static void copyResourceToDir(String resourcePath, File targetDir) {
125        if (targetDir == null) {
126            throw new IllegalStateException(String.format(
127                "could not copy the resource by path '%s' because the target directory is null", resourcePath));
128        } else if (targetDir.exists() && !targetDir.isDirectory()) {
129            throw new IllegalStateException(String.format(
130                "could not copy the resource by path '%s' because existing target '%s' is not a directory",
131                resourcePath, targetDir.getAbsoluteFile()));
132        }
133        ClassLoader classLoader = Thread.currentThread().getContextClassLoader();
134        URL resourceUrl = classLoader.getResource(resourcePath);
135        if (resourceUrl == null) {
136            throw new IllegalArgumentException(String.format(
137                "could not locate the resource by path '%s' to copy it into the target directory '%s'",
138                resourcePath, targetDir.getAbsoluteFile()));
139        }
140        try (InputStream resourceStream = resourceUrl.openStream()) {
141            Files.createDirectories(targetDir.toPath());
142            Path targetPath = targetDir.toPath().resolve(Paths.get(resourceUrl.toURI()).getFileName());
143            Files.copy(resourceStream, targetPath, StandardCopyOption.REPLACE_EXISTING);
144        } catch (URISyntaxException | IOException ex) {
145            throw new IllegalStateException(String.format(
146                "could not copy the resource by path '%s' (resource URL is '%s') into the target file '%s'",
147                resourcePath, resourceUrl, targetDir.getAbsoluteFile()), ex);
148        }
149    }
150}
